title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:17 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:17 <npm> has quit  
01:20 <npm\_> has quit  
01:20 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
01:26 <DrLou> has quit  
01:32 <abusenius> has quit  
02:54 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
03:37 <xilun> has joined #xwiki  
03:37 <xilun> hi  
03:40 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
03:41 <xilun> 'im giving a try to xwiki 3.1 and got an got an exception pretty similar to one i found googling: http://pastebin.com/NWNsYdd8  
03:41 <xilun> (only diff == line numbers)  
03:41 <xilun> anybody has an idea of what is happening ?  
03:42 <@cjdelisle> It has this part correct?  
03:42 <@cjdelisle> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.xpn.xwiki.internal.export.OfficeExporter  
03:42 <xilun> yep  
03:42 <@cjdelisle> I'm not an expert on the office exporter but I can certainly take a look for you.  
03:44 <@cjdelisle> Are you upgrading?  
03:44 <xilun> my real trace is http://pastebin.com/2tRQX0NL  
03:44 <xilun> and i'm using the XWiki Enterprise 3.1 from package  
03:44 <xilun> .zip  
03:44 <xilun> xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.1.zip  
03:46 <xilun> on a debian squeeze with $ java -version  
03:46 <xilun> java version "1.6.0\_18"  
03:46 <xilun> OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.8.7) (6b18-1.8.7-2~squeeze1)  
03:46 <xilun> OpenJDK Client VM (build 14.0-b16, mixed mode, sharing)  
03:46 <xilun> i'm not upgrading, it's right out of the .zip  
03:46 <@cjdelisle> That is odd, I wouldn't expect that to have any problems since it's tested pretty carefully before it's shipped.  
03:50 <DrLou> has quit  
03:51 <xilun> oh part of the pb is probably because of a bad manipulation on my part, i first used a java 1.5 by mistake, i tried again right now after a really clean unzip and it's still not working but the trace has changed  
03:51 <xilun> so i'm already 1/2 sorry for bothering and preparing to be fully sorry when i realize i made another mistake :p  
03:52 <@cjdelisle> Ok the 1.5 thing explains why a random class which is there appears to be missing.  
03:54 <xilun> new trace is http://pastebin.com/WRvzrhWq  
03:55 <xilun> and /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk/jre/lib/i386/xawt/libmawt.so does not exist in my fs  
03:56 <@cjdelisle> http://www.thetacticalnuke.com/2008/12/tip-fix-java-not-finding-libmawtso-ubuntu-810/  
03:58 <xilun> i'm trying it  
04:01 <xilun> ok now it's making a pdf, but title on the first page and at top of each page is : $msg.get("xe.dashboard.wiki.spaces")  
04:01 <xilun> i'll continue to investigate tomorrow :)  
04:01 <xilun> many thanks !  
04:05 <@cjdelisle> If you want to export pdf documents I highly recommend using the OfficeExport function where it uses OpenOffice to do the pdf generation.  
04:05 <@cjdelisle> That just means starting OpenOffice/LibraOffice server and connecting to it.  
04:05 <@cjdelisle> Once they are connected, your regular pdf export will be OpenOffice powered.  
04:07 <xilun> ok then i'll try that  
04:08 <xilun> thanks again, and good night if it's night at your place :)  
04:08 <@cjdelisle> Thanks
